intro.heading: Turn Every Ride into an Escape
intro.paragraph: Long commutes don’t have to be boring. With your EPL card, you can stream, listen, or read on the go—turning every bus or train ride into a chance to learn, relax, or escape into a great story.

access.heading: Turn Every Ride into an Experience!
access.paragraph: Your EPL card transforms your commute into something enjoyable and productive. Last year, thousands of Edmontonians borrowed digital content to make their transit time fly by. With your card, you can:
list: Transform your ride by accessing thousands of books anytime on your phone or tablet with Libby by OverDrive.
Watch top films and series on Kanopy during your commute—no ads, no fees.
Take your time to learn a new language with Mango Languages while you ride.
Stay informed! Read from top newspapers and magazines with PressReader and Flipster using your EPL card.

customerStories.heading: Customer Stories

whyGetEPLCard.heading: Why Get an EPL Card?
whyGetEPLCard.paragraph: With an EPL card, you can escape into captivating stories, explore new ideas, and learn something new, all while you commute. From audiobooks and eBooks to streaming movies and language learning, let your library card be your ticket to anywhere.

card1.heading: ONLINE RESOURCE
card1.content: Borrow eBooks and audiobooks anytime with Libby by OverDrive, the library reading app. Whether you're on the go or winding down at home, enjoy stories delivered straight to your device.

card2.heading: ONLINE RESOURCE
card2.content: Stay up to date with thousands of newspapers and magazines from around the world. From breaking news to lifestyle reads, PressReader keeps you informed and entertained.

card3.heading: ONLINE RESOURCE
card3.content: Stream quality films, documentaries, and shows anytime, anywhere. Kanopy gives you on-demand access to stories that entertain, educate, and inspire.

card4.heading: ONLINE RESOURCE
card4.content: Need a quick recommendation? Browse expertly curated book, movie, and music lists for every mood and moment. These picks are your shortcut to something great.

questions.title: What do I need to get a library card?
questions.text:
Getting your EPL card is simple. Visit any EPL location with identification (Drivers’ License, Alberta Health Care Card, etc.) and proof of Edmonton address in hand or signup online for a 45-day temporary card to start experiencing some of the benefits of EPL membership before visiting a branch to get a full membership.
If you're under 18, your parent or guardian must sign for you, and they'll be responsible for what you borrow.

questions.title: Do I need a library card to access the eBooks and online resources?
questions.text: We license our digital content from a number of companies (library vendors). The vendors require us to only allow our customers to access their products. For most products we are only licensed for the citizens of Edmonton. Your library card confirms your identity for the library vendors websites.

questions.title: Do University and College Students qualify for library cards?
questions.text:
Yes, and Library cards are free for all Edmonton Residents! Some schools even allow you to use your student card as your EPL card! This is called an L-Pass.

• U of A students and faculty - access EPL free with U of A L-Pass
• MacEwan University students, staff and faculty - access EPL free with MacEwan L-Pass.
• Concordia University College students and faculty - access EPL free with Concordia L-Pass (does not work in IE8 or earlier).
• Norquest students - access EPL free with Norquest L-Pass.
• King's University students - register here with your King's University library card number and PIN.
